intro: Bungarimba kahayanensis, commonly known as the Kahayan bungarimba, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
